text.p: Management Technologies Inc said it has postponed a previously scheduled shareholder meeting while it completes a reorganization.
The shareholder meeting was originally set for Monday, June 30, at 1500 EDT. It will be rescheduled for a date in early fall, the company said.

"We regret any inconvenience this rescheduling may cause any of our shareholders," President and Chief Executive Michael Edison said in a statement. "We are confident, however, that MTI's new course will meet with their approval when it is presented at a meeting we will set for the soonest possible date."

Earlier Thursday, the company also said Edison has assumed the additional duties of chief operating officer following the resignations of Chief Operating Officer Peter Morris and Product Director John Ridley.
Management Technologies develops, implements and supports software for international financial institutions.
